00059 #ifndef HEADER_BLOWFISH_H
00060 #define HEADER_BLOWFISH_H
00061 
00062 #include <openssl/e_os2.h>
00063 
00064 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00065 extern "C" {
00066 #endif
00067 
00068 #ifdef OPENSSL_NO_BF
00069 #error BF is disabled.
00070 #endif
00071 
00072 #define BF_ENCRYPT  1
00073 #define BF_DECRYPT  0
00074 
00075 /*
00076  * !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
00077  * ! BF_LONG has to be at least 32 bits wide. If it's wider, then !
00078  * ! BF_LONG_LOG2 has to be defined along.                        !
00079  * !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
00080  */
00081 
00082 #if defined(OPENSSL_SYS_WIN16) || defined(__LP32__)
00083 #define BF_LONG unsigned long
00084 #elif defined(OPENSSL_SYS_CRAY) || defined(__ILP64__)
00085 #define BF_LONG unsigned long
00086 #define BF_LONG_LOG2 3
00087 /*
00088  * _CRAY note. I could declare short, but I have no idea what impact
00089  * does it have on performance on none-T3E machines. I could declare
00090  * int, but at least on C90 sizeof(int) can be chosen at compile time.
00091  * So I've chosen long...
00092  *                  <appro@fy.chalmers.se>
00093  */
00094 #else
00095 #define BF_LONG unsigned int
00096 #endif
00097 
00098 #define BF_ROUNDS   16
00099 #define BF_BLOCK    8
00100 
00101 typedef struct bf_key_st
00102     {
00103     BF_LONG P[BF_ROUNDS+2];
00104     BF_LONG S[4*256];
00105     } BF_KEY;
00106 
00107  
00108 void BF_set_key(BF_KEY *key, int len, const unsigned char *data);
00109 
00110 void BF_encrypt(BF_LONG *data,const BF_KEY *key);
00111 void BF_decrypt(BF_LONG *data,const BF_KEY *key);
00112 
00113 void BF_ecb_encrypt(const unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out,
00114     const BF_KEY *key, int enc);
00115 void BF_cbc_encrypt(const unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out, long length,
00116     const BF_KEY *schedule, unsigned char *ivec, int enc);
00117 void BF_cfb64_encrypt(const unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out, long length,
00118     const BF_KEY *schedule, unsigned char *ivec, int *num, int enc);
00119 void BF_ofb64_encrypt(const unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out, long length,
00120     const BF_KEY *schedule, unsigned char *ivec, int *num);
00121 const char *BF_options(void);
00122 
00123 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00124 }
00125 #endif
00126 
00127 #endif
